SE450: Practice problems (Don't hand in): Problem 9 [12/16]

Consider the following Java program: 

public abstract class Animal {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Animal c = new Cat();
        Animal t = new Tiger();
        c.speak();
        c.strangeSpeak();
        makeSpeak(c);
        t.speak();
        t.strangeSpeak();
        makeSpeak(t);
    }

    public static void makeSpeak(Animal x) { x.speak(); }

    public void speak() { System.out.println("grunt"); }
    public abstract void strangeSpeak();
}

class Cat extends Animal {
    public void speak() { System.out.println("miaow"); }
    public void strangeSpeak() { super.speak(); }
}

class Tiger extends Cat {
    public void speak() { System.out.println("roar"); }
}

What is the output of this program? Briefly justify your answer.

What does the program print after the following method is added to the class Tiger? 

public void strangeSpeak() { super.speak(); }
